definition: certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Three surprising things came out of Starr’s testimony.
sentences.chinese: 斯塔爾的證詞中有三處令人喫驚。

sentences.english: We have seen few of the pertinent documents and heard little relevant testimony.
sentences.chinese: 我們看不到有關的文件，也聽不到相關的證詞。

sentences.english: It has taken a long time to wade through the 'incredible volume' of evidence.
sentences.chinese: 看完這一大卷“長篇累牘”的證詞花費了很長的時間。

sentences.english: Her testimony helped put several of the perpetrators behind bars.
sentences.chinese: 她的證詞將幾個罪犯送進了監獄。

sentences.english: The testimony tallies with the report.
Bank of Canada head Stephen Poloz is testify before the finance committee in Ottawa.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大央行行長波洛茲將在渥太華金融委員會作證詞。

sentences.english: In his testimony, Mr. Ko denied that he and Ms. Choi had been a couple.
sentences.chinese: 高永臺在證詞中否認他和崔順實曾是一對情侶。

sentences.english: They do not provide word-for-word or literal interpretation, nor do you want them to do so.
sentences.chinese: 一名口譯員曾對我講過他被要求口譯證詞的事。

sentences.english: New evidence showed that he lied at the trial.
sentences.chinese: 新的一些證據表明他在法庭上作了假證詞。

sentences.english: The case included 26, 000 pages of documents and 21 depositions.
sentences.chinese: 這個案子包括了26000頁的文檔和21條證詞。

sentences.english: Holmes urged the jury to ignore it.
sentences.chinese: 霍爾姆斯敦促陪審團忽略貝內關於基因的證詞。

sentences.english: The presiding judge asked if she wished to add anything to her testimony.
sentences.chinese: 首席法官問她是否還想對她的證詞補充些什麼。

sentences.english: The norwegians and danes flatly rejected the evidence.
sentences.chinese: 挪威人和丹麥人斷然地駁回了證詞。

sentences.english: The eyewitness can substantiate all the testimony .
sentences.chinese: 目擊證人能夠證實所有的證詞。

sentences.english: The records of what was said by the witnesses are called the depositions.
sentences.chinese: 證人證言的記錄就稱爲書面證詞。

sentences.english: The statement of the last witness controvert the evidence of the first two.
sentences.chinese: 最後一個證人的陳述反駁了前兩人的證詞。

definition: Edward Snowden (1983-), American surveillance program whistleblower
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
